SEARCH
Module brickGame
Package brickGame.Controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
brickGame.Controller.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameEngine.OnAction, EventListener, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent>
public class GameController extends Object implements javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent>, GameEngine.OnAction
The GameController class is responsible for controlling the game flow, handling user input, managing the game state, and interacting with the GameModel and GameView components.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameController()
    Constructs a GameController object with an associated GameModel and GameView.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    GameModel
    getModel()
    Returns the instance of the game model associated with this game controller.
    void
    handle(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
    Handles keyboard events, including movement, saving the game, and pausing/resuming the game.
    boolean
    isLoadFromSave()
    Returns true if the game is loaded from a save, false otherwise.
    void
    onInit()
    Initialization method called when the game controller is initialized.
    void
    onPhysicsUpdate()
    Handles physics-related updates, including checking destroyed block counts, ball physics, bomb interactions, removal of gold status, and bonus object interactions.
    void
    onTime(long time)
    Handles time updates in the game.
    void
    onUpdate()
    Updates the game view, handling non-normal block interactions and playing background music.
    void
    restartGame()
    Restarts the game with initial settings, including level, score, ball position, paddle position, and block configuration.
    void
    start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
    Starts the game by initializing the game elements, setting up the UI, and starting the game engine.

    • restartGame

      public void restartGame()
      Restarts the game with initial settings, including level, score, ball position, paddle position, and block configuration.

      public void onUpdate()
      Updates the game view, handling non-normal block interactions and playing background music.

    • onInit

      public void onInit()
      Initialization method called when the game controller is initialized. This method can be overridden to perform any necessary setup during the game initialization phase.
      Specified by:
      onInit in interface GameEngine.OnAction
